meanings.definition: To change from a liquid to a vapor
meanings.sent1: The puddle will evaporate in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The warm air made the water evaporate quickly.
meanings.sent3: I watched the spilled juice evaporate into thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her tears seemed to evaporate into the night.
meanings.sent5: The steam rising from the pot showed how water can evaporate.

meanings.sent1: The hope of finding the lost toy began to evaporate.
meanings.sent2: His excitement evaporated when he heard the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit evaporate from the hat.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day will never evaporate from my mind.
meanings.sent5: The music slowly evaporated into the silence of the room.

meanings.sent1: The magician can evaporate coins with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind can evaporate the clouds in no time.
meanings.sent3: The chef managed to evaporate all the leftovers in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The sun can evaporate the morning dew effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The sudden heat can evaporate the snow on the ground rapidly.
